samples.context: In the medical field, doctors who train rigorously gain expertise. Those who stay updated on research provide better care. However, doctors have restrictions on their time and they can either train rigorously or stay updated on research. Doctors either train rigorously or do not provide better care.
samples.question: Can we say that Neha, a doctor in the medical field, either gains expertise or does not stay updated on research?

samples.context: At a university, students who study hard earn high grades. Those who participate in extracurriculars develop leadership skills. However, students have restricted time outside of classes. They can either study hard or they do not develop leadership skills from extracurriculars.
samples.question: Can we conclude that Priya, a university student with limited free time, either earns high grades or does not participate in extracurricular activities?

samples.context: In relationships, partners who are affectionate strengthen their bond. Those who communicate resolve issues. However, some partners are affectionate while others communicate. They can't be extremely good at both concurrently. Partners either are affectionate or do not resolve issues well.
samples.question: Does this mean that for Mary, who is in a relationship, either strengthens her bond or does not communicate well?

samples.context: In politics, leaders who make big promises gain popularity. Those who focus on development bring positive change. However, some leaders make big promises while others focus on development. They can't do both simultaneously due to limited resources. Leaders either make big promises or do not bring positive change.
samples.question: Does this mean that the Prime Minister, a political leader, either gains popularity or does not focus on development?

samples.context: At companies, employees who work extra hours complete projects on time. Those who innovate come up with new ideas. However, some employees work extra hours while others innovate. They can't excel in both simultaneously with limited bandwidth. Employees either work extra hours or do not come up with new ideas.
samples.question: Can we say that Sam, an employee at a company, either completes projects on time or does not innovate?

samples.context: In a community, citizens who volunteer help those in need. Those who donate to charity organizations support important causes. However, citizens have limited time and money to allocate. They can either volunteer or they do not support important causes through donations.
samples.question: Does this mean that Luis, a busy working father, either helps those in need by volunteering or does not donate money to charity organizations?

samples.context: In a workplace, employees who collaborate effectively complete projects faster. Those who socialize during work hours form stronger bonds with coworkers. However, employees have limited time in the day. They can either collaborate or they do not form stronger bonds with coworkers.
samples.question: Does this mean that Susan, an employee focused on efficiency, either completes projects faster or does not socialize during work hours?

samples.context: In a large city, when people obey traffic rules, they avoid accidents on the road. Also, when they drive slowly, they reach their destination safely. However, some people drive fast while others obey traffic rules diligently. Drivers either obey traffic rules or do not reach their destination safely.
samples.question: Does this mean that Mark, a resident of the large city, either avoids accidents on the road or does not drive slowly?

samples.context: In an organization, employees who have good technical skills get promoted to leadership roles. Those who network effectively build strong professional relationships. However, some employees focus on improving technical skills while others network. Employees either have good technical skills or do not build strong professional relationships.
samples.question: Does this mean that David, an employee in the organization, either gets promoted to a leadership role or does not network effectively?

samples.context: In politics, candidates who campaign extensively gain more visibility. Those with strong policies earn people's trust. However, candidates are busy and can either campaign extensively or formulate strong policies. Candidates either campaign extensively or do not earn people's trust.
samples.question: Can we say that Priyanka, a political candidate, either gains more visibility or does not have strong policies?
